title.narrative: Provision of emergency integrated lifesaving primary health care services in Gedo region.

description.narrative: According to FSNAU Gu 2018 assessment report, critical GAM (18.3%) and serious SAM (2.8%) prevalence were recorded in Gedo region while health services in Elwak district are facing stock out of emergency medical supplies.The proposed project will be implemented in Gedo region particular Elwak district where ARD is implementing health and WASH. ARD implemented health project in Elwak district in partnership with SHF reserve allocation in 2017, which has ended in early 2018. However, with longstanding community partnership, the heath facilities have been functional through community contribution and ARD in kind of drugs and staff incentives. This has saved many vulnerable children and women affected by drought/AWD at target district. The proposed project will be targeting 19,000 drought-affected people with equity access to girls, women, boys and men through one health center and two mobile clinics. ARD will provide free outpatient consultations to 19,000 drought/AWD affected communities including 5700 girls, 5700 boys, 4750 women and 2850 men. Provision of emergency obstetric care including ANC, skilled delivery and PNC to 1750 eligible women and improve referral system through provision of transportation. The organization will conduct routine and supplementary immunization services to 20% of target population approximately 3800 children under the age of five years. In addition, the capacity of 35 staff will be improved through training while 350 community members will also be increased their knowledge and skills on disaster risk reduction, AWD prevention, identification of cases and early referral to health facilities. The organization is active health cluster member in Gedo and Mogadishu and will actively share information with health cluster members. The project will also be integrated into ongoing WASH project as integrated package of intervention. The target district is accessible, and the organization has active PCA with UNFPA in reducing maternal mortality rate through skilled deliveries and strengthening referral system in Somalia. There are reporting system that links to the EWAR system within the national surveillance system. ARD will report weekly/monthly IDSR /HMIS report for earlier detection of acute public health events, earlier and more effective response and reduce impact on health
